metadata.title: CVE-2019-12521 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Squid through 4.7. When Squid is parsing ESI, itkeeps the ESI elements in ESIContext. ESIContext contains a buffer forholding a stack of ESIElements. When a new ESIElement is parsed, it isadded via addStackElement. addStackElement has a check for the number ofelements in this buffer, but it's off by 1, leading to a Heap Overflow of 1element. The overflow is within the same structure so it can't affectadjacent memory blocks, and thus just leads to a crash while processing.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12521` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.11
squid-cgi - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.11
squid-common - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.11
squid-purge - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.11
squid3 - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.11
squidclient - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.12-1ubuntu7.11').
